page.title: 05ARDLEIGH PARK,ARDLEIGH
page.content: The house was built in{three parts, the{back}was built in the{14th {century,}the{middle}in the{18th {century}and the{front}in the{19th {century.}The old part was built with oak beams on the outside, then a cavity was left,and hazel twigs were put vertically with oak strips holding them secure with string which had been strengthened in candle wax.On top was daub, which is a mixture of straw and clay. The front of the middle section is 50cm.thick. Before{John Osborne arrived{Ardleigh Park}was known as{New {House;}it was changed to{Ardleigh Park because he thought it sounded grander! It is surrounded by park land and there are{nearly 100 oak trees}which are{150 years old approx.}We measured one, it took 5 of us to go around it, and the circumference measured 7 metres 50cm.
